definition: to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful

sentences.english: Whether or not that hand becomes less clenched is really up to them.
sentences.chinese: 那隻緊緊握拳的手是否會鬆開一些，無疑要看他們。

sentences.english: He clinched his hands. He knitted his brows and tightened his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他雙手握拳，雙眉緊蹙，嘴脣緊閉。

sentences.english: The two advanced on him with clenched fists.
sentences.chinese: 這兩人緊握拳頭向他進逼過來。
這兩人緊握拳頭向他進逼過來。

sentences.english: In textbooks, the former one is regarded better.
sentences.chinese: 一般教科書認爲，擺臂動作手指應是半握拳式。

sentences.english: The hand on the screen closes.
Don't approach life by clenching your fists.
sentences.chinese: 不要用緊握拳頭的方法來靠近生命。

sentences.english: Day jiang clenched fists waving to the smelly mouth shun, DE shi suddenly appear to stop.
sentences.chinese: 天江緊握拳頭揮向臭口順之際，德仕突然出現制止。

sentences.english: Half clenched their fists, half didn’t.
sentences.chinese: 一半參與者握緊了拳頭，另一半則沒有握拳。

sentences.english: Make a fist when the majority of the thumb adduction.
sentences.chinese: 握拳時多數是拇指內收。

sentences.english: He clenched his fists in frustrations.

definition: the five fingers of one's hand
to hold firmly, not let go
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
